plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to the Caucasus and Black Sea region, producing large clusters of bell-shaped flowers.
plants.location: Caucasus region, Europe, and parts of the United Kingdom
plants.funFact: Pontic Rhododendron is an invasive species in parts of the UK, covering large areas of heathland and suppressing native plants.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia shrub or small tree, famous for its large, fragrant cup-shaped flowers that appear before its leaves fully develop.
plants.location: Cultivated widely in temperate regions, native hybrid from China
plants.funFact: Saucer magnolias often bloom heavily even after late frosts, giving a spectacular floral display in early spring.

plants.name: Erythronium americanum
plants.description: A spring ephemeral wildflower native to eastern North American woodlands, characterized by nodding yellow flowers and mottled leaves resembling trout patterns.
plants.funFact: Yellow Trout Lily spreads through underground bulbs and can form large colonies, some believed to be hundreds of years old.
